message.content: This question requires knowledge about raccoon habitats. Raccoons are adaptable animals and are commonly found near human settlements where there is a consistent food source. Human garbage dumps provide an ample food supply for raccoons, making it the most likely choice for their habitat. Option (B) is incorrect because raccoons are not adapted to survive in icy barren tundras. Option (C) is also incorrect because raccoons require water sources, which are scarce in arid desert plains. Option (D) is incorrect because raccoons are not native to tropical rain forests.

This question requires some knowledge of the habitat preferences of raccoons. Raccoons are adaptable animals and can be found in a variety of habitats. However, they are commonly associated with living near human settlements and are known to take advantage of food sources such as garbage dumps. Option (A) is therefore the most likely answer. Option (B) is incorrect because raccoons are not typically found in icy barren tundras. Option (C) is also incorrect because raccoons prefer more wooded areas rather than arid deserts. Option (D) is not the best answer because while raccoons can be found in tropical rainforests, they are more commonly associated with human-inhabited areas.
